form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Scott (for himself and Mrs. Shaheen) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

form.official-title: To amend the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act to provide States with flexibility in determining the size of employers in the small group market.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Protecting Affordable Coverage for Employees Act or the PACE Act.

section.header: Small employers in the group market

subsection.text: Section 1304(b) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (42 U.S.C. 18024(b)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking 101 employees and inserting 51 employees;
in paragraph (2), by striking 100 employees and inserting 50 employees; and
by striking paragraph (3) and inserting the following:

paragraph.header: State option to extend definition of small employer
paragraph.text: Nothing in this subsection shall prevent a State from treating an employer with an average of at least 1 but not more than 100 employees on business days during the preceding calendar year as a small employer for purposes of this title.

subsection.text: Section 2791(e) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 300gg–91(e)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (2), by striking 101 employees and inserting 51 employees; and
in paragraph (4), by striking 100 employees and inserting 50 employees.
